Fun missions, gives me a lot of adrenaline especially at the later chapters.
Very enjoyable and an awesome experience, this was a good closure for the trilogy. I don't know what it was, but I enjoyed these two episodes more than the full game of Half Life 2.
htis is half life 4 so awesome

Some parts of this episode are better than base half life 2. Most parts are better than half life 2 episode 1. The gnome achievement is annoying as hell. The antlion caverns still bring me back to the first time I beat the game. It was a rainy summer day and looking at certain areas of the game still bring me back to remebering that day. Weird.
one of the best game ever i played.but, at ending it make you sad.because of half-life 3

Episode Two is important to the storyline, aswell as Episode One but this has a new, beautiful atmosphere that gives the player a new perspective on Half Life.
They gave the vortigaunts new characteristics. They're much cuter and more mysterious now.
We don't have to talk about the end.
Great gameplay, great story, just very fun.

When first getting Steam in 2005, I was not unfamiliar with the quality the Half Life 2 series had to offer. Though only recently completing both episodes 1 and 2, I can confirm that the gameplay and overall finesse gets better the deeper you dive into the storyline. This saga is truly one of a kind and will always hold a special place in my heart.

Amazing game, amazing story.
The gameplay holds up and remains fun and satisfying even 15 years after launch. However, in these 15 years, we have only moved forward in the storyline by about 5 minutes. It is left on a very, [b]very[/b] big cliffhanger.

Frankly, I have to say that I like the story line this time, but ironically, the story is still not obvious in the game. In fact, although there are many points to be criticized, I would like to thank them for not giving much place to the goddamn puzzles this time. Now you're going to ask why I don't like this game, right? My definitive answer is why did they break this game apart? Oh... I guess it must be for the extra money.
